name: Microsoft Virus Alert Scam
description: Scammer impersonates Microsoft security claiming the victim's computer is infected with viruses and their banking passwords are at risk, then directs them to a phishing support page and fake helpline.

turns.scammer_message: MICROSOFT SECURITY ALERT: Your Windows license has expired and your computer is infected with 23 viruses. Your personal data including banking passwords are at risk. Call Microsoft Support immediately.
turns.notes: Initial scare message impersonating Microsoft with virus and data theft threat.

turns.scammer_message: Our system scan has detected 23 critical threats on your device including Trojan.GenericKD and Spyware.BankLogger. Your banking credentials may already be compromised. Run our emergency security tool immediately: http://microsoft-support-india.help/fix to remove all threats.
turns.notes: Scammer shares phishing link disguised as Microsoft security tool.

turns.scammer_message: If you are unable to run the security tool, please call our Microsoft Certified Support Engineers at +91-8800556677 for remote assistance. Our technicians will connect to your computer and remove the viruses manually. This is a FREE service for all Windows users.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake tech support phone number for remote access scam.

turns.scammer_message: You can also email our senior security team at support@microsoft-helpdesk.tech with your device details and we will send you a personalized removal tool. Please include your Windows product key and the email address linked to your Microsoft account for verification.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake email to collect victim's Windows product key and personal info.

turns.scammer_message: CRITICAL WARNING: 3 of the 23 viruses have started encrypting your files. You have approximately 1 hour before your data is permanently lost.
